content:
I don't know its only me..but I feel like emoji size is a little bit on the high side when we compare it with text
Example: sample text :smiley: sample text

I was comparing it with twitter
Twitter have emoji size of 18X18 with text font size of 15px
And we are having emoji size of 25X25 with text font size of 14px
:thumbs_up: I agree, they feel large to me, too. :soccer:

We'd be willing to change that?
If so, please do.
Yeah my first reaction on using Zulip was = "Woahh these Emojis are way too big!"

One thing to note is that we're planning to increase the size of text in Zulip. But yeah, it's probably reasonable/correct to reduce the size of our emoji in markdown as well. I'm not sure what size we want to move to, however.
I guess we should consider the twitter's emoji size...they look perfectly sized

I merged f644f5fc2cc619141a6e0df78d68cab1044896d8 as an initial version of that.

I don't think one can just copy the sizing from another product that's using a different font, as different fonts have very different visual sizes for the same number of pixels. We're likely to want to play with this more when we execute plans to increase the default font size in Zulip one jump, but this should at least resolve the issue of them feeling jumbo (this change reduces their area by over a third).

Yash RE said:

We'd be willing to change that?
If so, please do.

In general, we're always willing to consider changes based on feedback; this is actually something we'd meant to do last summer that got derailed by my chronic illness.
It's bothered me for a long time but I thought it was a design decision. Glad to see it being changed :).
